intro: Chamaecrista nictitans var. glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, exhibiting a trailing or erect growth habit. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the summer months. The variety glabrata is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other varieties of Chamaecrista nictitans.
